when_to_say: Used when greeting someone during the day.
example: Konnichiwa! Ogenki desu ka? (Hello! How are you?)

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude.
example: Arigatou gozaimasu! (Thank you very much!)

when_to_say: Used when parting from someone.
example: Sayounara! Mata ne! (Goodbye! See you later!)

when_to_say: Used when greeting someone in the morning.
example: Ohayou gozaimasu! (Good morning!)

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree.
example: Hai, wakarimashita. (Yes, I understand.)

when_to_say: Used to decline or disagree.
example: Iie, arigatou gozaimasu. (No, thank you.)

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: Sumimasen, doko desu ka? (Excuse me, where is it?)

when_to_say: Used to confirm understanding.
example: Wakarimashita! (I understand!)

when_to_say: Used to ask about someone's well-being.
example: Ogenki desu ka? (How are you?)

when_to_say: Used when referring to a friend.
example: Kare wa tomodachi desu. (He is my friend.)

when_to_say: Used to refer to studying or studying activity.
example: Benkyou ga suki desu. (I like studying.)

when_to_say: Used to refer to a school.
example: Gakkou ni ikimasu. (I am going to school.)

when_to_say: Used to express eating action.
example: Asagohan wo tabemasu. (I will eat breakfast.)

when_to_say: Used to express drinking action.
example: Koucha wo nomimasu. (I drink tea.)

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fun or enjoyable.
example: Tanoshii desu ne! (It's fun, isn't it?)

when_to_say: Used to describe a busy situation or person.

when_to_say: Used to describe weather.
example: Ame ga futteimasu. (It's raining.)

when_to_say: Used to refer to home or house.

when_to_say: Used to express waking up.
